title: Advanced Diploma in Principles of Industrial Engineering
headline: Free online course on the principles, tools as well as the various techniques associated with Industrial Engineering.
description: This free online course on the Principles of Industrial Engineering provides a comprehensive guide to the principles, tools, and techniques associated with the industrial engineering field. Learn about organizational structure of the industrial engineering industry, types of Industries available in this sector, and optimization of the processes for producing goods and services. Begin this course today and improve your engineering knowledge.
courseDescription:
This free online course on the Principles of Industrial Engineering will begin by introducing you to the engineering approach to the various aspects of production and distribution of goods. You will learn the principles, tools, and techniques associated with the industrial engineering field. You will also learn in detail about the organizational structure of the industrial engineering industry, and the types of Industries available in this sector.

This course will then introduce you to the core of Industrial Engineering and how it ensures the utilization of goods and services are realized through the optimum use of resources.  The optimization of the various processes in use for producing goods and services, through the development, improvement, and implementation of the integrated system of resources that are in use during production.

Finally, this course will introduce you to the multi-disciplinary approach of Industrial Engineering as it involves the knowledge of science and mathematical principles to evaluate and predict the resources needed to produce goods and services. You will learn how to reduce wastage of resources while improving the utilization of resources and increasing the efficiency as well as the effectiveness of the system.

Start Course Now

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs.   • Tools of IE and Organizational Structure I

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary:
    • The concept of Industrial engineering can be divided into two broad areas of Industry and engineering. An industry is an organization or enterprise where things are produced or distributed in the form of products and services. There are three types of industries - primary, secondary and tertiary industries.
    • In the last two to three centuries, a lot of notable development has taken place in the industrial environment field. 
    • There are four functions associated with industrial engineering, and they are; plan design,
      facility layout, management and operations, and production planning and control. 
    • The general objective of Industrial Engineering as covered in this module is to enhance productivity, eliminate waste and non-productive activities, as well as to increase the effective utilization of resources.
    • The specific objectives of Industrial engineering on the other hand is to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the organization by developing procedures for administration and operation, as well as to develop the vision and mission for the organization's long term goals.
    • The various tools and techniques available in industrial engineering that can be used for the optimum utilization of resources, reducing wastage, and increasing productivity, thereby reducing the cost of goods and services that are produced were explained in this module.
  • Learning Outcomes
  • Upon the successful completion of this module, you should be able to:
    • Discuss the concept of the organizational structure of industrial engineering.
    • Explain the importance of the coordination between the different groups and the functions of the organization Identify the roles.
    • Explain how coordination can be achieved across the different functions of the organization.
    • Identify the types of organizational structure.
    • Differentiate between the functional organization and matrix organization.
    • Explain the different factors that govern the manufacturing industries in developing product strategies.
    • Identify the different features related to the different types of product manufacturing strategies.
    • Explain the features of the process and product-focused organizational structures.
    • Discuss the importance of having a very healthy and good organizational culture.
    • Discuss the principles associated with the development of the organizational structures.
    • Identify the factors that we should be considered while designing an organizational structure.

  • Lesson Summary
    • Every organization consists of two types of resources, non-human resources, like machines, equipment, systems, testing facilities, manufacturing units, reception, dispatching, delivery etc., and the humans that will utilize the non-human resources. Out of the two resources of an organization, humans are the most important.
    • This module also discusses the reason why the coordination of both the human and non-human resources can be achieved by breaking it down to different functions in an organization, with the attendant roles that each individual will play to achieve the organizational goal.
    • There are three types of organizational structures, and they are line organization, functional organization, and the matrix organization.  The kind of features that should be in a typical futuristic organizational structure were discussed.
    • There are factors that govern the manufacturing industries with respect to different product strategies and the different features related with the different types of the product manufacturing strategies.
    • According to the stage of the product in its growth cycle, the type of manufacturing strategies that should be used are identified.
    • The three types of organizational structures based on manufacturing strategies are the process focused organizational structure, product-focused organizational structure, and the mixed organizational structure which is also known as the metrics organizational structure.

  • Plant Location & Layout: Economic Returns on Investment

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary
    • The primary goal of manufacturers is to manufacture products and provide services to customers at the lowest possible price and the best possible quality so that manufacturers can effectively compete and increase their customer base. So, all the factors, including the total cost at which the product will be delivered to the customer must be considered while choosing a particular plant location and layout. 
    • Market location is the most important factor to be considered while selecting a site.  The market can be centralised which means it can be located in one place, or decentralised which means scattered all over. 
    • The factor rating method and the point rating method of selection of sites were discussed. The point rating method gives more freedom to consider the relative importancThe of the various factors of selection of a site.
    • The other three methods of selection of site are; the load distance method, breakeven analysis method, and center of gravity method.
    • The delphi method is also known as the qualitative method.
    • This module concluded by looking at the benefits of the different methods of site selection, and which one to adopt.
  • Learning Outcomes
  • Upon the successful completion of this module, you will be able to:
    • Discuss the load distance method for the identification of a suitable site.
    • Explain the gravity method of site selection and the economic method that considers return on investment.
    • Explain the purposes of developing a good plant layout.
    • Discuss the classes of the plant layout and types of plant layouts.
    • Differentiate between the different classes of plant layout and types of plant layouts.
    • Discuss the concept of process layout.
    • Identify the types of plant layouts and their features.
    • Differentiate between the suitability of product layout and process layout.
    • Identify the features of the cellular layout.
    • Explain under which conditions the cellular layout is beneficial.
    • Discuss the factors to consider while designing the process layout.
    • Identify the steps used for designing the process layout.

  • Plant Layout: Product Layout Design

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary
    • The load distance method suitability for the identification of site with regards to the different distribution points was discussed in this module.
    • It is important to modify and improve an existing layout as a result of some situations. The purposes of developing a good plant layout, the different classes of the plant layout and the different types of the plant layouts.
    • The three types of layout are the product layout, the combination layout, and the fixed layout. 
    • Product layout is used for mass production purposes where continuous operation will help in realizing the goal of the high volume production. The fixed layout is used for fabrication or manufacturing things where one main component is a heavy and it is capped at a particular location while all other resources like labor, man, material, machines are brought to that location so that work can be done.
    • The combination layout exploits the benefits of both product and process layout.
    • The flow matrix method is used to quantify the kind of movement between the different locations. 
    • The procedure for designing the process layout considering considers the frequency of movement, distance to be traveled, and the cost which will be incurred on account of the per unit distance to be traveled.
    • In product layout, facilities and work centers are arranged according the sequence in which the operations will be performed on a product.
  • Learning Outcomes
  • Upon the successful completion of this module, you will be able to:
    • Discuss the concept of organization of facility.
    • Identify the factors that need to be considered while organizing facilities.
    • Identify the different types of building designs.
    • Explain the importance of ventilation, lighting, and climate conditions in organizing facilities.
    • Discuss the need for material handling in the course of manufacturing.
    • Explain the different objectives of material handling.
    • Identify the types of equipment that can be used for material handling.
    • Identify the factors that should be considered, while choosing a suitable type of material handling system.
  • Organization of Facility

  • Material Handling

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary
    • This module looked at the arrangement of manufacturing processes and machines, and also how to accommodate the various facilities that are needed in a plant.
    • The plant building is one of the most important factors to consider while organizing facilities. 
    • There different types of building designs, like the single story building, multi story building, high bay building, and special building.
    • Organization of facilities in a plant is significantly affected by the plant building design, facilities for workers, the kind of ventilation available, lighting, and other climatic conditions.
    • In the course of production, materials pass from one stage to another. Materials move from its raw condition to the semi-finished condition to the finished condition. 
    • The cost related with material handling can be as high as sixty to eighty percent of the total production cost. So, if the material handling related aspect is not designed and executed effectively, the material handling cost may be very high and the production system may be inefficient.
